name: Hotel Niles Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wanted to spend 3 or so days in Istanbul (had already done a beach trip to Antalya, but really wanted to see Constantinople before I relocate back home to VA) so got on to Trip Advisor. I tried, first, the Dersaadat, because of its ranking, etc. They were full, but I guess they're in league with Niles since they recommended availability and comparable price there. So I made reservations there for our stay from June 9-12 and am glad that I did!
reviews.title: Awesome hotel!

likes.liked: — It was all great...also didn't mention in review text, there's a free internet station...and I think they've got wireless, but I don't travel with a laptop

reviews.text: The front office manager, Seda, was great every step of the way...first setting everything up over email and explaining what the hotel has to offer (breakfast, room rates if paid in cash, discounts, airport transfers, etc.). When we got there and met her in person she was super friendly, helped us get checked-in, and later during our stay was extremely helpful in explaining where all the big sites were and how to get on the Bosphourus Cruise down at Eminunu. This saved us some dough; a round trip ticket with a stop off for lunch costs only 12.5 Turkish Lira! If you book this through an agency/travel company, it will probably run you like 50 Euro or something. And you don't need a guide...walk down there yourself or take the tramline, buy the ticket yourself (and the Ministry of Tourism or the Ferry service has English-speaking attendants to answer your questions)...get on the boat (early for a good seat on the deck), sit back and enjoy the sites! This will take up most of one day (with the lunch stop) if you leave at 10:30 or so...you get back at like 16:30 or so.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem in Istanbul

likes.disliked: — finding it when we arrived, there are so many small hotels and our taxi dropped us quite a distance away with insufficient directions

reviews.text: More about the hotel...ALL staff extremely friendly. Breakfast in the mornings is modest but has all the essentials and even fresh baked Turkish breads which were delicious. The room was very nice, with air conditioning. If you are disturbed by the early/late calls to prayer, close your window and turn the AC on. It's that simple. And as one reviewer commented, it adds to the flavor or your stay...you realize that you really are in a Muslim country (I counted three different prayers simultaneously being spoken from three different mosques near the hotel).
reviews.title: Hotel Niles is an absolute gem

likes.liked: — The staff at the hotel, especially Seda!
likes.disliked: — The rooms are a bit small.

reviews.text: The room was clean with a key-locked safe. Television with a couple English channels (but you're not there to watch TV). Bathroom was just fine, very clean, looked newly renovated, sort of a European efficiency style, if there's such a thing (cabinet style shower/no tub with toilet and wash basin in about a 5'x5' space). One full bed (plenty of room for two). All this plus breakfast and a friendly staff for under 60 Euro a night. You can't go wrong.
reviews.title: Beautiful, friendly and well-run

reviews.text: Istanbul itself was great. Definitely recommend going for 3 or 4 days...you'll be busy non-stop. We visited Topkapi, Hagia Sofia, blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, Archaeology Museum, Museum of Turkish and Islamic Arts, the Cistern, Suleiyman Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, walked around Istanbul University...all of this is within 10-15 minutes from the hotel. I mentioned the Bosphorus cruise above...and we also took the tram line accross the Golden Horn and visited the Dolmabahce palace (Seda's directions were very helpful here, too!).
reviews.title: Great staff, good breakfasts, a bit noisy

reviews.text: I stayed here for four nights over last weekend
reviews.title: Hotel Niles is Absolutely Brilliant

reviews.text: It is brilliantly located- only 5 minutes from Tram
reviews.title: Hotel Niles means the best of Istanbul

likes.disliked: — some of the light fixtures did not work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms are great- nice firm beds, has wireless access for the internet.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The breakfast which is served on the roof terrace is delightfull.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay at Hotel Niles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Nice and new!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an enjoyable three night stay at Hotel Niles which is situated in the middle of the rag trade business area. There is easy access to transport links. Staff are helpful and Seda at the front desk is absolutely wonderful. Breakfast on the roof terrace was great. There is not much I can add that others have not ;-))
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay at Hotel Niles

likes.disliked: — in the middle of the rag trade business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on the strength of other Trip Advisor reviews and can definitely recommend it. The location is excellent, only 200 metres from the Grand Bazaar and the main tram line through Sultanhamet, down to the Bosphorus. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Staff are lovely; friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Owned by the same company that owns the much more expensive Deserdaat!
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel, great staff

reviews.text: This is my first experience with a family owned hotel. I can't add more about the quality of the service provided and already mentioned by the previous reviews. The manager, Seda, Sami, Mezut and the rest of the staff were all great, always ready to help with the smile. It's a small hotel well located in Beyazit district very close to Tram and the major attractions. It's not a luxury hotel but EXTREMLY clean. Yes that's true you hear some noise in the hallway especialy if you're close to the elevator but what you can do, it's human issue especially because of those coming drunk late at night. Anyway if you're looking for a nice, clean, well located and most of all great service and value, this is the one. Also no need to hire a guide in Istanbul. Just when you decide to go somewhere talk to anyone at the recepetion especially Seda, she will give an extremly detailed itinerary with routes, timing, prices and all the tips to make it easy for you. Again I've been to many hotels around the world and never had such an outstanding customer service.
reviews.title: Best service ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought this was a solid small hotel. The best thing about it was the location. I am never fond of being in the middle of tourist areas and instead prefer to be in a real neighborhood. This hotel is a short easy walk along a main street to the main tourist sights.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a better place than most tourist hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I suggest you make an inquiry as to the condition of the street around the hotel. Turks like to work on their streets from midnight to 5 AM and this can wreak havoc on your sleep as its very loud.
reviews.title: Great location and staff!

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the Niles. The service is excellent, location good and rooms fair. It is a clean, simple hotel in a good location for touring. The restaurant options are limited in that area. The rooms are small and the beds are hard. The bathrooms seem to have been recently redone. The rooftop terrace restaurant is nice and the food excellent. I would recommend this hotel because of the kind and attentive service of the staff. Also, take a map and address with you if you need a taxi to take you to the hotel. NONE Of the taxi drivers could find the hotel.
reviews.title: Clean Simple Hotel

likes.disliked: — The size of the rooms and quality of the beds

reviews.text: Finding the Niles Hotel was a happy chance. Their sister hotel in the more touristic Sultan Ahmet region was full. We were not disappointed. Quite the reverse. We had an excellent stay.
reviews.title: Delightful hotel and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although difficulties at the airport delayed our arrival, we were met by our pre-arranged taxi (very reasonably priced). In half an hour we were being warmly welcomed by Seda - one of the most impressive receptionists I have had the pleasure to come across. Our room was simple, but it was comfortable, very clean with a more than adequate shower-room and a (free) safe. Although deep in the Istanbul rag-trade district, the street was very quiet at night. The aircon worked well and our four nights at the Niles were restful.
reviews.title: Most helpful Front of House Staff Ever

likes.liked: — So close to all the top sights
likes.disliked: — Hotel was off a main road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upstairs, on the roof garden, the service was impeccable, with free tea, coffee and juice and swift service for other essentials, like beer. The fresh orange juice was . . . just perfect.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service and Value

reviews.text: Breakfast was well organised and although busy, the food was plentiful and there always seemed to be a table. The view of the Sea of Marmara was a joy and the street scenes from this rooftop endlessly fascinating.
reviews.title: Great Roof Terrace, Location, and VERY Friendly staff!

likes.disliked: — Towels had too much fragrance in them

description: Hotel Niles Istanbul is a family owned and managed small hotel located in the Grand Bazaar district of the old city. Located 3 minutes of walk away from the Grand Bazaar, and 12 minutes of walk from the Blue Mosque, St Sophia and the Topkapi Palace, Hotel Niles Istanbul aims to offer its guests a convenient setting for exploring the old city.
